title: Business Application Analyst
description:
D-Fend Solutions values its employees as our greatest asset. Our professionals and subject matter experts, including personnel from elite military intelligence technology units, provide the best possible solutions to our leading customers around the world. We are proud of our impressive presence across different environments and industries, as well as the results we have helped our customers achieve in contending with their counter-drone challenges.

In addition to professional expertise, D-Fend Solutions seeks candidates who will thrive in a fast-moving, innovative and collaborative culture. It helps if you enjoy having fun – our “D-Fenders” are a light-hearted bunch who have stashed rubber ducks all around our headquarters.

Are you interested in working with the world’s leading cyber-takeover counter-drone technology provider?

Join D-Fend Solutions in helping to make the world a safer place by addressing emerging challenges in the dynamic and exciting counter-drone arena!

The Business Application Analyst will be responsible for supporting the configuration, maintenance, and enhancement of our Netsuite ERP system to meet the evolving needs of our organization.
This role will collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to understand the business requirements, translate them into technical solutions, and drive continuous improvement initiatives within the Netsuite environment
Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document business requirements for Netsuite ERP system’s enhancements and customizations.
Configure Netsuite modules, workflows, and dashboards to support business processes and improve operational efficiency.
Serve as the primary point of contact for Netsuite end-users, providing training, support, and troubleshooting assistance, as needed.
Conduct ongoing system testing, validation, and quality assurance to ensure accuracy and reliability of Netsuite data and processes.
Follow Netsuite updates, releases, and best practices to identify opportunities for system optimization and enhancement.
Review and document system configurations, processes, and procedures to support knowledge sharing and ensure system integrity.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering and Management, Information Systems, or related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in Netsuite management, configuration, and support.
Strong understanding of Netsuite modules such as Inventory Management, Order Management and Financials.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Netsuite certification(s) preferred.
Field of Expertise: Business Analysis, ERP, NetSuite, Inventory Management, Order Management, Financials
Soft Skills: Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Technical Skills: Netsuite, Inventory Management, Order Management, Financials

title: Game Data Analyst
description:
As a Game Data Analyst, you'll be diving deep into the Hybrid gameplay metrics, helping us understand our players, and playing a critical role in shaping our future and current titles. You'll work closely with the development studio, game design, and product teams to offer insights that can drive our games to new heights.

Responsibilities
Analyzing gameplay data to understand player behavior and identify areas of improvement.
Leveraging tools like BigQuery, Looker Studio, and Google services to extract, process, and visualize data.
Collaborating with design and product teams to refine game economy and balance.
Tracking and analyzing KPIs to suggest optimization strategies.
Providing actionable recommendations based on your analysis.
Deep game understanding behind data.

Qualifications
Proficiency in BigQuery and Looker Studio - a plus
Strong background in game analysis, particularly in Hybrid games- a plus
Technical knowledge of Unity - a plus
A minimum of 1-year experience in a similar role.
Experience with Python for data processing and analysis.
Deep understanding of statistical formulas and their application in the gaming context.
A solid foundation in the gaming industry and an understanding of current trends.
Field of Expertise: Data Analysis, Game Design, Game Development, Machine Learning, Statistics
Technical Skills: BigQuery, Looker Studio, Google services, Python, Unity

title: Data Analyst
description:
Company Overview
KLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and we invest 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.
Job Description
KLA is looking for a Data Analyst to join us!
The ideal candidate is data-oriented personality, capable of taking business needs and translating them into numbers, KPI's and metrics. You'll responsible for defining and analyze requirements and set the technological course for data-related initiatives. Consolidate data from different sources in order to find connections and trends, data validity issues. You will handle and support data collecting tool -from adding data to the DB to visualization in PBI.
You will work on different time zones with peers from various countries.
Minimum Qualifications
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst (at least two years)
Technical expertise
regarding data models, database design
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Python knowledge (high level) - most of the analysis shall be done in Python, including data visualization
SQL knowledge
Strong
analytical skills
with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages
Power BI - advantage
Skills:
Problem-solving skills
Accuracy and attention to detail
Team-working skills
Verbal and Written communication skills
BSc degree or higher in exact sciences
We offer a competitive, family friendly total rewards package. We design our programs to reflect our commitment to an inclusive environment, while ensuring we provide benefits that meet the diverse needs of our employees.
KLA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer
Field of Expertise: Data Analysis, Business Data Analysis, Data Modeling, Database Design, Python, SQL, Statistics, Power BI
Soft Skills: Problem-solving skills, Accuracy and attention to detail, Team-working skills, Verbal and Written communication skills
Technical Skills: Python, SQL, Power BI, data models, database design, statistical packages

title: Staff Frontend Engineer - Singularity Data lake
description:
About Us:
SentinelOne is defining the future of cybersecurity through our XDR platform that automatically prevents, detects, and responds to threats in real-time. Singularity XDR ingests data and leverages our patented AI models to deliver autonomous protection. With SentinelOne, organizations gain full transparency into everything happening across the network at machine speed – to defeat every attack, at every stage of the threat lifecycle.
We are a values-driven team where names are known, results are rewarded, and friendships are formed. Trust, accountability, relentlessness, ingenuity, and OneSentinel define the pillars of our collaborative and unified global culture. We're looking for people that will drive team success and collaboration across SentinelOne. If you're enthusiastic about innovative approaches to problem-solving, we would love to speak with you about joining our team!
What are we looking for?
We are continuously expanding the capabilities of SentinelOne, actively listening to customers and responding to their needs. We're looking for a Staff Software Engineer to join SentinelOne's Singularity Data Lake area. Singularity Data Lake, is a common foundation enabling seamless implementation of unified security analyst workflows and integration of SentinelOne ecosystem with 3rd-party security ecosystems via SentinelOne Marketplace.
The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated individual with a track record of delivering modern web applications with outstanding user experience and performance in B2B domain.
What will you do?
You will help us build the next-generation scalable web application using state of the art technologies.
You will be partnering with our product management to deliver and evolve several foundational software services which are part of SentinelOne's Singularity Data Lake.
You will drive design decisions to improve the product architecture and ensure the team's adherence to engineering best practices.
You will help identify areas for proactive improvement based on team findings.
You will be involved in the whole SW development process - from product discovery, through designing architecture, implementation and testing to delivery to production and subsequent monitoring.
What experience and knowledge should you bring?
Several years of hands-on experience with frontend web development
Proven experience with ReactJS and GraphQL
Understanding of Object Oriented programing methodologies
Proven experience with CSS
Excellent communication, interpersonal and problem solving skills
Ability to understand and implement complicated scenarios
You enjoy and understand how to create a superior user experience
It'd be great if you have experience with / or You'd learn & gain on our team:
Experience with implementing/connecting to REST APIs
Experience working with Jenkins
Backend development experience (we can utilize your/offer you a full-stack overlap with BE development in Java, Kotlin, or Go)

Why Us?
You will be joining a cutting-edge company where you will tackle extraordinary challenges and work with the very best in the industry.
Study Funds- SentinelOne contributes 7.5% over your base salary (no tax ceiling is applied), and employees contribute 2.5% of their base salary
Pension fund- SentinelOne contributes to your pension fund according to local law. Pension contribution may vary based on the selected plan.
RSUs- 4 years vesting with 1-year cliff and then quarterly.
Annual bonus (depending on the performance of the company) paid out in 2 cycles
Employee Stock Purchase Plan- The plan enables employees to purchase SentinelOne stocks at discounted prices vs. market value. (the plan is subject to local taxation)
Company time off and holidays
Private medical insurance
Meal allowance
Home office allowance
Hybrid work model- The possibility of working both from the office and working from home
Parental Leave - Embracing a new child into the family is a unique moment for everyone! In support of that, we offer 20 weeks of fully paid leave for the birth parent and 12 weeks of paid leave for the non-birth parent
Employee Assistance Program- Psychological sessions with certified therapists to help you overcome stress, personal and professional challenges
Free Parking in our office building
Music Room fully equipped room
Wellness- workout sessions and a wellness app

SentinelOne is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
SentinelOne participates in the E-Verify Program for all U.S. based roles.
Field of Expertise: Software Engineering, Web Development, Frontend Development, ReactJS, GraphQL, CSS, REST APIs, Java, Kotlin, Go
Soft Skills: Excellent communication, interpersonal and problem solving skills
Technical Skills: ReactJS, GraphQL, CSS, REST APIs, Jenkins, Java, Kotlin, Go

title: SRH Programme Associate
description:
The Position
The SRH Programme Associate (PA) will work under the supervision of SRH program analyst and in close cooperation with the UNFPA team based in Jerusalem and Gaza. He/she will support the planning, management, and monitoring of sexual and reproductive health component of UNFPA’s country programme. The Programme Associate will maintain operational relationships with various stakeholders, such as the Palestinian Authority, Civil Society and academic institutions.
The Programme Associate will apply established systems and procedures and assists in the creation of substantive knowledge by compiling, synthesizing and analyzing information relevant to reproductive health program implementation appropriate mechanisms and systems and ensuring compliance with established procedures.
1. How you can make a difference:
UNFPA is the lead UN agency for delivering a world where every pregnancy is wanted, every childbirth is safe and every young person's potential is fulfilled. UNFPA’s strategic plan (2022-2025), reaffirms the relevance of the current strategic direction of UNFPA and focuses on three transformative results: to end preventable maternal deaths; end unmet need for family planning; and end gender-based violence and harmful practices. These results capture our strategic commitments on accelerating progress towards realizing the ICPD and SDGs in the Decade of Action leading up to 2030. Our strategic plan calls upon UN Member States, organizations, and individuals to “build forward better”, while addressing the current humanitarian situation on women’s and girls’ access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights, recover lost gains and realize our goals.
In a world where fundamental human rights are at risk, we need principled and ethical staff, who embody these international norms and standards, and who will defend them courageously and with full conviction.
UNFPA is seeking candidates that transform, inspire, and deliver high impact and sustained results; we need staff who are transparent, exceptional in how they manage the resources entrusted to them and who commit to deliver excellence in programme results.
2. Job Purpose
The SRH Associate will contribute to the achievement of SRH program goal and objectives as related to the country program document. He/She will be responsible to develop his/her own plan to monitor progress with partners and SRH stakeholders in the country and to convene meetings and technical discussions as needed.

3. You Will Be Responsible for:
Assist in the identification and formulation of the country programme and component projects (both development and humanitarian) related to sexual and reproductive health, by compiling and analyzing information in the subject areas of UNFPA assistance to the national Government and other stakeholders;
Drafts work plans and works with partners on regular reporting based on agreed on monitoring tools.
Contributes to monitoring and evaluation of SRH project and programme activities, establishing and implementing mechanisms to systematically assess the achievement of results, conducting field visits, participation in review meetings and evaluation missions and preparing regular inputs to status and progress reports including for humanitarian projects related to sexual and reproductive health;
Analyses basic factors affecting the achievement of results, recommends corrective actions and follow up on recommendations;
Maintains updated information on SRH commodity procurement and follows-up with relevant partners on FP supply, distribution, consumption pattern and stocks to avoid any shortfalls or stock-outs;
In coordination with national counterparts and project personnel, guides routine implementation of assigned projects, coordinating the delivery of projects inputs, ensuring participation of national counterparts in training activities and study tours;
Provides logistical support to projects by coordination of review meetings and other project related workshops and events;
Coordinates with operations on provision of training and supports project personnel and staff on national execution and programme policies and procedures;
Contributes to the creation and sharing of knowledge by synthesizing and documenting findings and lessons learned, success stories and best practices, strategies and approaches of the Country office and drafting relevant materials for dissemination;
Support the process of raising requisitions, follow up the process until final delivery of products.
4. Job Requirements
Education:
Completed secondary level education required. Bachelor’s degree in health sciences preferably in public health, Midwifery/Nursing or social sciences desirable.

Knowledge and Experience:
7 years of relevant experience in project management and coordination within public or private sector.
Significant experience partnering or working with a variety of partners, including civil society, the government (Ministry of Health preferred), the UN, and international organizations.
Sound understanding of health data and statistics; experience collecting such data for monitoring purposes would be valuable; experience of monitoring and evaluation of humanitarian programs in the health sector Experience with advocacy work, with extra experience with SRH.
Proficiency in current office software applications Values:
Exemplifying integrity
Demonstrating commitment to UNFPA and the UN system
Embracing cultural diversity
Embracing change

Core Competencies:
Achieve results
Being accountable
Developing and applying professional expertise/ business acumen
Thinking analytically and strategically
Working in teams/ managing ourselves and our relationships
Communicating for impact

Functional Skill Set:
Advocacy/ Advancing a policy-oriented agenda
Leveraging the resources of national governments and partners/ building strategic alliances and partnerships
Delivering results-oriented programs
Internal and external communication and advocacy for results mobilization

Languages:
Fluency in English & Arabic.
Field of Expertise: Public Health, Midwifery, Nursing, Social Sciences, Project Management, Health Data and Statistics, Monitoring and Evaluation, Advocacy, Sexual and Reproductive Health
Soft Skills: Teamwork, Communication, Integrity, Commitment to UNFPA and the UN system, Cultural Diversity, Embracing change, Accountability, Working in teams/ managing ourselves and our relationships, Communicating for impact
Technical Skills: Project Management, Data Analysis, Monitoring and Evaluation, Advocacy, Public Health, Midwifery/Nursing, Social Sciences, Office Software

title: Product Data Analyst
description:
As a Product Data Analyst in the AI Team at 365Scores, you will play a crucial role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that drive our AI-driven product features. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze user behavior, develop key performance metrics, and support the continuous improvement of our AI applications. Your work will directly influence product strategies and enhance user experiences for millions of sports fans globally.

Requirements:
Proven experience (3+ years) as a Data Analyst, preferably within a product or technology-focused company.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI. Experience with machine learning frameworks is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data analysis and reporting.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

Responsibilities:
Conduct in-depth analysis of large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support product decisions and strategies.
Develop, track, and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate the effectiveness of AI features and overall user engagement.
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to assess the impact of new features and optimizations.
Create and maintain detailed reports and interactive dashboards to communicate findings and monitor product performance.
Work closely with product managers, data scientists, engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate data-driven insights into product development processes.
Conduct user research and usability studies to gather qualitative data, complementing quantitative analysis.
Ensure the accuracy and consistency of data collected from various sources and support data cleaning and preprocessing activities.
Utilize machine learning models and statistical techniques to predict user behavior and identify opportunities for product enhancements.
Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of methodologies, analyses, and processes to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing.
Field of Expertise: Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Analysis, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering
Technical Skills: SQL, Python, R, Tableau, Power BI, Machine Learning frameworks

title: BI Data Analyst עבור חברה יציבה
description: BI Data Analyst עבור חברה יציבה במרכז הארץ. התפקיד כולל ביצוע אנליזות, ניטור ביצועי המוצרים, זיהוי טרנדים, הסקת מסקנות, מתן המלצות על פי הממצאים מהדאטה, ליווי צוות הפרודקט והמנהלים בקבלת החלטות, בניית דשבורדים ודו"חות, שיפור מתמיד של תהליכים ושיטות ניתוח נתונים. - שנה ניסיון בעבודה עם POWER BI -עבודה עם SQL ברמה גבוהה - ניסיון עם Google Analytics - יתרון משמעותי
Field of Expertise: Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, SQL, Power BI, Google Analytics

title: People Analyst
description:
Today’s world is crime-riddled. Criminals are everywhere, invisible, virtual, and sophisticated. Traditional ways to prevent and investigate crime and terror are no longer enough…
Technology is changing incredibly fast. The criminals know it, and they are taking advantage. We know it too.
For nearly 30 years, the incredible minds at Cognyte around the world have worked closely together and put their expertise to work, to keep up with constantly evolving technological and criminal trends and help make the world a safer place with leading investigative analytics software solutions.
We are defined by our dedication to doing good and this translates to business success, meaningful work friendships, a can-do attitude, and deep curiosity.
We are seeking you, that is passionate about data and brings a strategic and analytical mindset, focused on promoting and building the infrastructure for the domain.
As a Cognyter you will:
Build and analyze reports and dashboards to provide the people team and company leadership with data-driven recommendations and actionable insights.
Utilize statistical models and predictive analysis to forecast future trends and make data-driven recommendations for talent management strategies.
Translate complex people data into clear and impactful stories that connect people insights with organizational goals.
Ensure data integrity and structure throughout all people processes to drive effective data utilization.
Lead the change management in the organization to build a data driven culture including training and supporting the people organization in utilizing data.

Requirements:

For that mission you’ll need:
5+ years of proven experience as a Data Analyst / BI role, with experience in People Analytics.
Extensive data and analytical expertise including knowledge of People industry best practices, processes, and measurement standards.
Hands-on experience working with Data Analysis / BI / Data Visualization tools (Tableau or similar BI tool) and excel.
Strong data management background and experience.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English and Hebrew.
Experience working with People systems (Success Factor, Comeet or similar).

Career Page:
People
Field of Expertise: Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, People Analytics
Soft Skills: Communication, Teamwork, Strategic thinking, Analytical mindset, Data-driven, Curiosity

title: לארגון מוביל בת"א, Data Analyst
description:
לארגון פיננסי מבוסס ומצליח אשר משרדיו ממוקמים באזור המרכז, דרוש/ה Data Analyst. העבודה במשרה מלאה וקבועה בעיר – תל אביב יפו. קיימת אפשרות של עבודה מהבית. תיאור התפקיד עבודה שוטפת מול מאגר נתונים.

פיתוח ותחזוקת מודולים ב – SQL. פיתוח ותחזוקה של Dashboards ו – Qlik Sense. פיתוח מודלים לחזוי, מדדים וכלים לניהול המדדים. ביצוע ניתוחים Ad Hoc וניתוחים תקופתיים, תוך שילוב של הבנה עסקית עם הנתונים.

הצגת נתונים ותובנות להנהלה, גזירת מסקנות וכיווני פעולה. ביצוע של חשיבות כמותית + פיננסית. 5 – 3 שנות ניסיון בתפקיד Data Analyst או תפקיד אחר דומה. ניסיון תעסוקתי עם בסיסי נתונים הכולל כתיבת SQL וביצוע וויזואליזציה של נתונים.

ניסיון תעסוקתי ברמה גבוהה עם תוכנת Microsoft Excel. ניסיון באיסוף וריכוז נתונים והצגתם, בניית דו"חות ומצגות. ניסיון עם תהליכי תכנון כוח אדם ותקינה, ניהול תקציבי ובכלל זה תקציבי שכר. ניסיון בביצוע מחקר ואיתור Bench Marks לצורך בניית מדדים ומודלים בעולמות תוכן שונים.

ידע או ניסיון בפיתוח בכלי Qlik Sense – יתרון. ידע או ניסיון עם מערכת Sap – יתרון. ידע או ניסיון עם יחידות בנק ותהליכים פנים ארגוניים – יתרון. השכלה אקדמאית בתעשייה וניהול או ניהול וכלכלה או מדעי המחשב או סטטיסטיקה או חשבונאות.
Field of Expertise: Data Analysis, SQL, Dashboard Development, Qlik Sense, Forecasting Models, Data Visualization, Microsoft Excel, Financial Analysis, Human Resources Planning, Budgeting, Research and Benchmarking, Qlik Sense, SAP, Banking, Business Management, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, Accounting
Technical Skills: SQL, Qlik Sense, Microsoft Excel, SAP

title: 2024 Corporate & Investment Bank - Investment Banking Analyst Program - Off-Cycle Internship (November - April) Tel Aviv
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Join our team of top professionals for an internship that shapes the global economy. We focus on long-term relationships and strategies that foster growth and innovation for our clients. We provide sound advice, access to funds, and connections, while managing risks in today's complex environment. Your diverse perspective will help us innovate the next wave of products and solutions. We offer comprehensive training, mentoring from senior leaders, and engaging projects to ensure your success.
Job Summary
As a 2024 Corporate & Investment Bank - Investment Banking Analyst Program - Off-Cycle Internship (November - April) - Tel Aviv within JPMorgan Chase, you will spend your internship alongside top professionals in the business, developing strategies that help our government, institutional, and corporate clients grow and innovate. You will have the opportunity to analyze market data, manage client transactions, and come up with innovative solutions to complex business challenges. We will provide you with the necessary support and training to help you succeed in this dynamic and collaborative work environment.:
Job responsibilities
Analyse market data, building detailed financial models and preparing client presentations for mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts and capital markets advisory.
Manage client transactions from pitch to close under the guidance of our senior leaders.
Come up with innovative and creative ways to solve complex, real-world business challenges.
Learn how we help clients and communities grow, no matter their needs.
Sharpen your technical skills.
Build your professional network with mentors, senior executives and others.
Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills.
Excellent analytical, quantitative and interpretative skills
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative work environment
Being adaptable, flexible and resilient
Knowing your way around Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Fluency in English and Hebrew
Expected graduation date between January 2023 and August 2024. If you plan to pursue further education beyond your undergraduate studies, please ensure this is accurately reflected in the graduation date entered on your application
You must be available during the months stated in the Job Title
Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills
Being on-track for a United Kingdom 2:1 Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in your undergraduate studies.
But beyond that, what we’re most interested in are the things that make you, you: the personal qualities, outside interests and achievements beyond academia that demonstrate the kind of person you are and the difference you could bring to the team.
Application deadline: 31st July 2024
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage you to submit your application as early as possible as programs will close once positions are filled.
Join Us
At JPMorgan Chase, we’re creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you’re passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we’re looking for you.
What’s Next
Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it’s important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.
After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.
If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you’ll receive an email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.
Completion of the HireVue video interview is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed it. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete this as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.
ABOUT US

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.
Field of Expertise: Investment Banking, Finance, Data Analysis, Financial Modeling, Client Management

title: AI/Data Product Manager
description:
365Scores is a leader in sports analytics and entertainment, delivering real-time scores, news, and comprehensive analytics to millions of sports enthusiasts worldwide. Our mission is to enhance the sports fan experience with personalized content, making every sports moment more accessible and engaging.
365Scores is seeking an experienced AI/Data Product Manager to join our dynamic team. Reporting directly to the Head of AI, this pivotal role will spearhead the integration and application of artificial intelligence within our product offerings, enhancing user experiences through AI-driven innovations. The successful candidate will lead a talented team comprising a Data Analyst, an R&D Engineer, and an MLOps Specialist, driving the development and execution of AI-based product features such as personalized news feeds and trend generators.

Requirements:
Proven experience (5+ years) in product management, with a strong focus on AI/Data-driven products.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage complex product development cycles.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record of leveraging data to drive product decisions.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders and build consensus.
Strong understanding of AI technologies and their application in enhancing user experiences and product offerings
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning - is an advantage.

Responsibilities:
Lead the ideation, technical development, and launch of innovative AI-powered product features.
Collaborate closely with the Head of AI and Stakeholders to identify, analyze, and prioritize new AI/ML features and use cases that can enhance 365Scores' products, and will align with the company's strategic goals and product roadmap.
Manage and oversee the product lifecycle for AI applications, from concept through launch and beyond, ensuring alignment with user needs and business objectives.
Lead research initiatives to understand user needs and industry trends, driving the design of personalized AI features that resonate with sports fans.
Work cross-functionally with Data Analysts, R&D Developers, Design, Data Scientists, and marketing teams to bring AI product features to market.
Define KPIs and metrics to assess the performance of AI features, ensuring that data-driven insights inform continuous improvement.
Keep abreast of the latest AI technologies and trends, assessing their potential impact on the company's product offerings.
Field of Expertise: Product Management, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Data Analysis, Software Engineering, User Experience, Marketing
Technical Skills: AI technologies, Machine Learning, Data Analysis

title: לסטארט אפ בתל אביב Fraud Operation Analyst
description: Fraud Operation Analyst חובה - ניסיון בחברות אינטרנט עם מנויים (subscription) / ניסיון בביצוע אנליזות על התנהגות היוזרים. Fraud Operation Analyst Bachelor’s degree from exact-sciences related areas such as: Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Industrial engineering, Computer Science or a related field - Must 2 years of experience as a data analyst - Must Experience in applying statistical techniques - Must Experience in working in an operational environment - Must Proficiency in working with SQL databases - Must Experience in fraud/risk analysis Familiarity with Python and the Pandas package Excellent expression skills both verbal and in writing in English is a must

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Atera is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join the team and work side by side with the rapidly growing sales department.
The ideal candidate is a high proficient in solving complex business questions and has the capability to read complex datasets and translate them into actionable business insights and recommendations to the relevant stakeholders.
If you are an expert in data & numbers, have a keen eye for detail, an innate ability to recognize patterns, and the drive to influence key business decisions with your findings, then we want you on our team!

Responsibilities:
working closely with our Sales team leadership, providing strategic recommendations based on your data analysis.
Lead deep dive analyses to uncover new opportunities for growth that will influence our business performance
Create and maintain comprehensive and clear dashboards to track key KPIs and highlight actionable insights for operational teams and senior management.
Ensure the integrity and accuracy of our sales data by regularly validating and updating our datasets.
Suggest strategic changes or initiatives that can boost our performance and efficiency.

Requirements:


5+ years experience as a Business Analyst/ Data Analyst/ RevOps analyst
Experience from a B2B SaaS company — a huge advantage
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with great attention to detail
Excellent Excel and SQL proficiency
Experience with data visualization platforms (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Etc.)
Experience working with B2B Sales teams — advantage

Some of our benefits
Atera is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time to learn from your teammates, time off to relax and recharge, community volunteer days, an annual budget to support your learning & growth, a company paid trip and lots more.

More about Atera
Atera is inventing a new way of managing IT end-to-end for IT professionals and IT teams around the world.
By creating an AI-powered IT platform, Atera's all-in-one Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) Helpdesk, Ticketing, and Reporting solution helps more than 23,000 IT pros achieve 10X operational efficiency, cut down time-to-resolution, and deliver better outcomes faster. Located in the heart of Tel-Aviv, our team of passionate, like-minded individuals is driven by a shared mission to unleash everyone's potential and constantly innovate. We create an open, transparent, and supportive environment that gives our teams the autonomy, resources, and freedom to thrive.
Field of Expertise: Data Analysis, Business Analysis, Sales, Revenue Operations
Soft Skills: Communication, Teamwork, Attention to Detail, Problem-Solving
Technical Skills: Excel, SQL, Looker, Tableau, Power BI

title: Finance Analyst
description:
Company Description

Publicis Groupe is one of the largest advertising agency holding companies in the world as well as a global leader in the fields of marketing, communications, and digital transformation. Driven by data, cutting-edge technology, and creativity, our solutions enable brands to provide customers with tailored experiences on a large scale. We utilise the Power of One operating model to integrate and develop competencies that will create increasing business value for existing and future clients. We are present in more than 100 countries and employ in excess of 90,000 professionals. Publicis Groupe includes world-renowned agencies such as Saatchi & Saatchi, Leo Burnett, Publicis Sapient, Zenith, Starcom, Publicis Health, and Epsilon amongst others.
Publicis Re:Sources is part of the Global organization Publicis Groupe providing support to our agencies in over 100 countries. Although we are spread around the world we are one Re:Sources team, excited by challenges and relentless in our pursuit of excellence. Re:Sources is a high energy environment fuelled by collaboration, imaginative thinking and initiative. At Re:Sources, we’re the backbone of Publicis Groupe, we provide our peers technology, finance, operations, and legal solutions that enable them to excel with their clients

Job Description
Monitor and control the group bank transactions in Israel.
Daily bank reconciliations, follow-up on wire transfers, direct debits, and customer payments
Cashflow management and customer payments allocation.
Preparation of daily, weekly, and monthly reports, to the local management and global treasury team
Maintain and ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial master data for vendors and customers.
Develop and enforce data management policies and procedures.
Support internal and external audits

Qualifications
Certified bookkeeper Diploma or Type 3, bachelor’s degree in finance, Business administration, or any related field will be an advantage.
3 – 5 years of experience in corporate treasury, finance, data management, or related areas.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel.
Working experience in multiple currency ERP systems, Priority will be an advantage.
High level of accuracy, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills
Motivated, fast learner, with problem-solving and decision-making capabilities
Fluent in English in both writing and speaking.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Soft Skills: High level of accuracy, attention to detail, exceptional organizational skills, Motivated, fast learner, problem-solving, decision-making, communication, interpersonal

title: Product Analyst Lead
description:
About the Role :
EverC is a pioneer of advanced technology that provides risk intelligence for global enterprises. We’re here to power e-commerce growth and keep it safe from illicit products and services.
We’re working with the world’s leading fintech and marketplaces to unlock new business opportunities by highlighting the good and ensuring lightning-speed removal of the bad.
Our growing customer base includes JPMorgan, Mastercard, Visa, Amex, Adyen, Ali Pay, Amazon Pay, Intuit, Nuvei, Payoneer, Wix, eBay, Wish, Fruugo, and more
We’re backed by Viola Capital, American Express Ventures, Nyca Partners, Arbor Ventures, Kroll Red-Dot, and Bow Wave Capital, bringing the total capital invested to above $100M. Our growing product team consists of strong professionals and great people with proven track records.

Your opportunity:
Join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in shaping our data-driven decision-making culture, driving product optimization, and ensuring our company remains at the front of the industry.
If you are passionate about product analysis, feature impact, and working with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment… we invite you to apply and be part of our exciting journey.
Responsibilities:
To Enable data-driven decision-making for product teams, executives, and the organization.
Present insights to stakeholders clearly and concisely, verbally and through visualizations, ensuring non-technical audiences easily understand BI information.
Investigating and solving product and business challenges
Creating dashboards, interpreting data, sharing insights, and developing models that improve every aspect of the product
Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging trends in product analytics, data analysis, and visualization techniques.
Qualifications:
Data-driven! Experience with online product analysis: retention, funnel, feature impact, etc., Demonstrated leadership in guiding teams through complex data analysis and driving impactful decisions.
Self-learner, capable of multi-tasking, working independently, and highly organized with a “can-do” approach.
At least 4+ years of experience as a senior data/product analyst, preferably within a fast-growing B2B SaaS company
Proven experience using SQL, Python/R – advantage
Knowledge and a solid understanding of big data and ETL process
Experience working with BI & visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, etc.)
(Advantage) BA/BSc in Industrial Engineering, Economics, information systems, Statistics, or equivalent field
Strong communication skills & Proficiency in English
₪30 - ₪32 a month
Field of Expertise: Data Science, Product Analysis, Business Intelligence, SQL, Python, R, Data Visualization
Soft Skills: Communication, Teamwork, Self-learner, Multi-tasking, Independent Work, Organization
